Love in Another Language  by İlksen Başarır (Turkey, 2009, 98 min.)

İlksen Başarır’s award-winning debut invites us into the world of the hearing impaired through an unlikely love affair. When Zeynep—a call-center employee who spends her days talking with people she doesn’t know—meets Onur—a young, deaf and mute librarian—at a party, she believes can find peace with this man who cannot speak. The film portrays the challenges faced by the couple as they build  their relationship with with each other and the world around them. MFA Description

Love in Another Language is one of 16 films screening at this year's Boston Turkish Film Festival at the MFA. There is  little information about this film available on the web, but I for one am intrigued by the scenario and hope you may be too.

Here's a link to a Turkish website with further description/analysis: http://tarkanplusint.wordpress.com/2010/03/28/love-in-another-language/

After the film, as is our custom, we will go to a nearby restaurant for our group discussion.

Hope to see you there,

Tom
